abstract.text: Broadcast your playlist, mix, or set along with your voice, to the world. Tune in to other broadcasts and jump in the conversation with comments, or show your support with quick reactions. An interactive UI for AutomixIQ.

topicSections.title: Initializing PacemakerRadio for use with Tuned Global’s APIs

inlineContent.text: PacemakerRadio is a framework that exposes an interactive UI to AutomixIQ as well as the capability to leverage Pacemaker Technology to start a broadcast with music from your catalog, your voice and other content, as well as joining available broadcasts, interact with other members of a community or the broacaster, and more.
AutomixIQ is included in this framework as well, and it supports the PacemakerRadio technology, but it can also be used standalone.
This documentation provides a step-by-step guide on how to get started with using the PacemakerRadio in your application.

abstract.text: How data is passed to and from PacemakerRadio
AutomixSDKMixtapeTrack models a track in a mixtape
AutomixSDKMixtape models a mixtape
TunedAuthenticationResponse models the response of a Tuned OAuth request
Accessing the PacemakerRadio framework
RadioUIDelegate protocol defines the methods to be implemented by a class tasked with providing the Automix SDK the user interface requires for social features.
AutomixSDKMixtapeTrackImage models the image for a track in a mixtape
Availablity of underlying technologies and APIs.
AutomixSDKTrackModel models a track. This metadata is required.
AutomixSDKPluginMetadataModel models metadata of a track traditionally obtained by running plugins on it. Key and BPM are recommented for best mixing.
The Type entry for bpm and key are “key” and “bpm” (case sensitive) respectively, the values need to be formatted as strings, and the key needs to be in OpenKey format.
AutomixSDKUser models a user
AutomixSDKLogLevel is an enum of all the AutomixIQ available log levels
TunedMusicCacheDelegate protocol defines the methods to be implemented with storing and providing cached track data
What errors the PacemakerRadio player can issue to help with player integration

Broadcast your playlist, mix, or set along with your voice, to the world. Tune in to other broadcasts and jump in the conversation with comments, or show your support with quick reactions. An interactive UI for AutomixIQ.
AutomixSDKPlaylistOperation models a move, add or remove operation of a track in a playlist.
AutomixIQ playback mode
AutomixSDKArtistModel models an artist.
AutomixSDKStatusObserverDelegate protocol defines the methods to be implemented with observing the status of AutomixIQ to reflect it on a UI.
RadioSDK represents the Radio SDK and exposes all its functionality. It follows a Singleton pattern.
How to validate your client and start using the PacemakerRadio SDK with Tuned Global APIs
AutomixSDK represents the AutomixIQ SDK and exposes all its functionality. It follows a Singleton pattern.
AutomixSDKStreamingDelegate protocol defines the methods to be implemented with providing AutomixIQ the information it requires to play content.
AutomixSDKMixtapeCounters models the set of counters for information about a mixtape
TunedRestDelegate protocol defines the methods to be implemented that will provide AutomixIQ the credentials and identifiers to Tuned Global’s backend
How to learn which broadcasts are currently live.
AutomixSDKStatus models the State of the AutomixSDK during playback.

overview-tuned-demo-radio.alt: A player interface that uses PacemakerRadio to broadcast a show.

abstract.text: AutomixIQ status variable type
What AutomixIQ stores locally
AutomixSDKWaveformBlob models the data to create a waveform shape representing a track
Tools to interact with the social layer.
AutomixSDKGenericList models a list of things
How to start playing a broadcast by a user that is currently live
AutomixSDKMixtapeLite models a mixtape with the minimum required fields
AutomixSDKWaveformModel models the waveform of a track.
Creating a draft for a radio show and presenting the UI to curate it, then going live.
AutomixSDKPlaybackEventType is an enum of all the available playback events
